intro: Juno nusairiensis, commonly known as the Nusairi juniper, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the Cupressaceae family, which includes various types of cypress and juniper trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, needle-like foliage and small, scale-like leaves that are typically blue-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Juno nusairiensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
